column3: The proverbs of Solomon son of David king of Israel
column4: The proverbs of Solomon, son of David, king of Israel:

column3: To know wisdom and instruction to understand words of insight
column4: To know wisdom and instruction, to understand words of insight,

column3: to receive instruction in wise dealing in righteousness justice and equity
column4: to receive instruction in wise dealing, in righteousness, justice, and equity;
column5: Receive, Instruction, Dealing, Wise, Righteousness, Justice, Equity

column3: to give prudence to the simple knowledge and discretion to the youth
column4: to give prudence to the simple, knowledge and discretion to the youth—

column3: Let the wise hear and increase in learning and the one who understands obtain guidance
column4: Let the wise hear and increase in learning, and the one who understands obtain guidance,

column3: to understand a proverb and a saying the words of the wise and their riddles
column4: to understand a proverb and a saying, the words of the wise and their riddles.

column3: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge fools despise wisdom and instruction
column4: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge; fools despise wisdom and instruction.
column5: Fear, Beginning, Knowledge, Fools, Despise, Wisdom, Instruction

column3: Hear my son your father’s instruction and forsake not your mother’s teaching
column4: Hear, my son, your father’s instruction, and forsake not your mother’s teaching,
column5: hear, Son, Father, Instruction, Forsake, Mother, Teaching

column3: for they are a graceful garland for your head and pendants for your neck
column4: for they are a graceful garland for your head and pendants for your neck.

column3: My son if sinners entice you do not consent
column4: My son, if sinners entice you, do not consent.

column3: If they say Come with us let us lie in wait for blood let us ambush the innocent without reason
column4: If they say, “Come with us, let us lie in wait for blood; let us ambush the innocent without reason;
column5: Come, Lie, Wait, Blood, Ambush, Innocent, Reason

column3: like Sheol let us swallow them alive and whole like those who go down to the pit
column4: like Sheol let us swallow them alive, and whole, like those who go down to the pit;
column5: Sheol, Swallow, Alive, Whole, Down, Pit

column3: we shall find all precious goods we shall fill our houses with plunder
column4: we shall find all precious goods, we shall fill our houses with plunder;

column3: throw in your lot among us we will all have one purse
column4: throw in your lot among us; we will all have one purse”—

column3: my son do not walk in the way with them hold back your foot from their paths
column4: my son, do not walk in the way with them; hold back your foot from their paths,
column5: Son, Walk, Way, Hold, Foot, Paths

column3: for their feet run to evil and they make haste to shed blood
column4: for their feet run to evil, and they make haste to shed blood.
column5: Feet, Run, Evil, Haste, Shed, Blood

column3: For in vain is a net spread in the sight of any bird
column4: For in vain is a net spread in the sight of any bird,

column3: but these men lie in wait for their own blood they set an ambush for their own lives
column4: but these men lie in wait for their own blood; they set an ambush for their own lives.

column3: Such are the ways of everyone who is greedy for unjust gain it takes away the life of its possessors
column4: Such are the ways of everyone who is greedy for unjust gain; it takes away the life of its possessors.
column5: Ways, Greedy, Unjust, Gain, Away, Life, Possessors

column3: Wisdom cries aloud in the street in the markets she raises her voice
column4: Wisdom cries aloud in the street, in the markets she raises her voice;

column3: at the head of the noisy streets she cries out at the entrance of the city gates she speaks
column4: at the head of the noisy streets she cries out; at the entrance of the city gates she speaks:
column5: Head, Noisy, Cries, Entrance, City gate, Speaks

column3: How long O simple ones will you love being simple How long will scoffers delight in their scoffing and fools hate knowledge
column4: “How long, O simple ones, will you love being simple? How long will scoffers delight in their scoffing and fools hate knowledge?
column5: Simple, Love, Scoffers, Delight, Fools, Knowledge

column3: If you turn at my reproof behold I will pour out my spirit to you I will make my words known to you
column4: If you turn at my reproof, behold, I will pour out my spirit to you; I will make my words known to you.
column5: Turn, Reproof, Behold, Pour, Spirit, Words, Known

column3: Because I have called and you refused to listen have stretched out my hand and no one has heeded
column4: Because I have called and you refused to listen, have stretched out my hand and no one has heeded,

column3: because you have ignored all my counsel and would have none of my reproof
column4: because you have ignored all my counsel and would have none of my reproof,

column3: I also will laugh at your calamity I will mock when terror strikes you
column4: I also will laugh at your calamity; I will mock when terror strikes you,

column3: when terror strikes you like a storm and your calamity comes like a whirlwind when distress and anguish come upon you
column4: when terror strikes you like a storm and your calamity comes like a whirlwind, when distress and anguish come upon you.
column5: Terror, Strikes, Storm, Calamity, Whirlwind, Distress, Anguish

column3: Then they will call upon me but I will not answer they will seek me diligently but will not find me
column4: Then they will call upon me, but I will not answer; they will seek me diligently but will not find me.

column3: Because they hated knowledge and did not choose the fear of the LORD
column4: Because they hated knowledge and did not choose the fear of the LORD,

column3: would have none of my counsel and despised all my reproof
column4: would have none of my counsel and despised all my reproof,

column3: therefore they shall eat the fruit of their way and have their fill of their own devices
column4: therefore they shall eat the fruit of their way, and have their fill of their own devices.
column5: Eat, Fruit, Way, Fill, Own, Devices

column3: For the simple are killed by their turning away and the complacency of fools destroys them
column4: For the simple are killed by their turning away, and the complacency of fools destroys them;
column5: Simple, Killed, Turning away, Complacency, Fools, Destroy

column3: but whoever listens to me will dwell secure and will be at ease without dread of disaster
column4: but whoever listens to me will dwell secure and will be at ease, without dread of disaster.”
column5: Listens, Dwell, Secure, Ease, Dread, Disaster

column3: My son if you receive my words and treasure up my commandments with you
column4: My son, if you receive my words and treasure up my commandments with you,

column3: making your ear attentive to wisdom and inclining your heart to understanding
column4: making your ear attentive to wisdom and inclining your heart to understanding;

column3: yes if you call out for insight and raise your voice for understanding
column4: yes, if you call out for insight and raise your voice for understanding,

column3: if you seek it like silver and search for it as for hidden treasures
column4: if you seek it like silver and search for it as for hidden treasures,

column3: then you will understand the fear of the Lord and find the knowledge of God
column4: then you will understand the fear of the Lord and find the knowledge of God.

column3: For the Lord gives wisdom from his mouth come knowledge and understanding
column4: For the Lord gives wisdom; from his mouth come knowledge and understanding;

column3: he stores up sound wisdom for the upright he is a shield to those who walk in integrity
column4: he stores up sound wisdom for the upright; he is a shield to those who walk in integrity,

column3: guarding the paths of justice and watching over the way of his saints
column4: guarding the paths of justice and watching over the way of his saints.

column3: Then you will understand righteousness and justice and equity every good path
column4: Then you will understand righteousness and justice and equity, every good path;

column3: for wisdom will come into your heart and knowledge will be pleasant to your soul
column4: for wisdom will come into your heart, and knowledge will be pleasant to your soul;

column3: discretion will watch over you understanding will guard you
column4: discretion will watch over you, understanding will guard you,

column3: delivering you from the way of evil from men of perverted speech
column4: delivering you from the way of evil, from men of perverted speech,

column3: who forsake the paths of uprightness to walk in the ways of darkness
column4: who forsake the paths of uprightness to walk in the ways of darkness,

column3: who rejoice in doing evil and delight in the perverseness of evil
column4: who rejoice in doing evil and delight in the perverseness of evil,

column3: men whose paths are crooked and who are devious in their ways
column4: men whose paths are crooked, and who are devious in their ways.

column3: So you will be delivered from the forbidden woman from the adulteress with her smooth words
column4: So you will be delivered from the forbidden woman, from the adulteress with her smooth words,

column3: who forsakes the companion of her youth and forgets the covenant of her God
column4: who forsakes the companion of her youth and forgets the covenant of her God;

column3: for her house sinks down to death and her paths to the departed
column4: for her house sinks down to death, and her paths to the departed;

column3: none who go to her come back nor do they regain the paths of life
column4: none who go to her come back, nor do they regain the paths of life.

column3: So you will walk in the way of the good and keep to the paths of the righteous
column4: So you will walk in the way of the good and keep to the paths of the righteous.

column3: For the upright will inhabit the land and those with integrity will remain in it
column4: For the upright will inhabit the land, and those with integrity will remain in it,

column3: but the wicked will be cut off from the land and the treacherous will be rooted out of it
column4: but the wicked will be cut off from the land, and the treacherous will be rooted out of it.

column3: My son do not forget my teaching but let your heart keep my commandments
column4: My son, do not forget my teaching, but let your heart keep my commandments.

column3: for a length of days and years of life and peace they will add to you
column4: for a length of days and years of life and peace, they will add to you.

column3: Let not steadfast love and faithfulness forsake you bind them around your neck write them on the tablet of your heart
column4: Let not steadfast love and faithfulness forsake you; bind them around your neck; write them on the tablet of your heart.

column3: So you will find favor and good success in the sight of God and man
column4: So you will find favor and good success in the sight of God and man.

column3: Trust in the Lord with all your heart and do not lean on your own understanding
column4: Trust in the Lord with all your heart, and do not lean on your own understanding.

column3: In all your ways acknowledge him and he will make straight your paths
column4: In all your ways acknowledge him, and he will make straight your paths.

column3: Be not wise in your own eyes fear the Lord and turn away from evil
column4: Be not wise in your own eyes; fear the Lord, and turn away from evil.

column3: It will be healing to your flesh and refreshment to your bones
column4: It will be healing to your flesh and refreshment to your bones.

column3: Honor the Lord with your wealth and with the firstfruits of all your produce
column4: Honor the Lord with your wealth and with the firstfruits of all your produce;

column3: then your barns will be filled with plenty and your vats will be bursting with wine
column4: then your barns will be filled with plenty, and your vats will be bursting with wine.

column3: My son do not despise the Lords discipline or be weary of his reproof
column4: My son, do not despise the Lord’s discipline or be weary of his reproof,

column3: for the Lord reproves him whom he loves as a father the son in whom he delights
column4: for the Lord reproves him whom he loves, as a father the son in whom he delights.

column3: Blessed is the one who finds wisdom and the one who gets understanding
column4: Blessed is the one who finds wisdom, and the one who gets understanding.

column3: for the gain from her is better than gain from silver and her profit better than gold
column4: for the gain from her is better than gain from silver, and her profit better than gold.

column3: She is more precious than jewels and nothing you desire can compare with her
column4: She is more precious than jewels, and nothing you desire can compare with her.

column3: Long life is in her right hand in her left hand are riches and honor
column4: Long life is in her right hand; in her left hand are riches and honor.

column3: Her ways are ways of pleasantness and all her paths are peace
column4: Her ways are ways of pleasantness, and all her paths are peace.

column3: She is a tree of life to those who lay hold of her those who hold her fast are called blessed
column4: She is a tree of life to those who lay hold of her; those who hold her fast are called blessed.

column3: The Lord by wisdom founded the earth by understanding, he established the heavens
column4: The Lord by wisdom founded the earth; by understanding, he established the heavens;

column3: by his knowledge the deeps broke open and the clouds dropped down the dew
column4: by his knowledge, the deeps broke open, and the clouds dropped down the dew.

column3: My son do not lose sight of thesekeep sound wisdom and discretion
column4: My son, do not lose sight of these—keep sound wisdom and discretion,

column3: and they will be life for your soul and adornment for your neck
column4: and they will be life for your soul and adornment for your neck.

column3: Then you will walk on your way securely and your foot will not stumble
column4: Then you will walk on your way securely, and your foot will not stumble.

column3: If you lie down you will not be afraid when you lie down your sleep will be sweet
column4: If you lie down, you will not be afraid; when you lie down, your sleep will be sweet.

column3: Do not be afraid of sudden terror or of the ruin of the wicked when it comes
column4: Do not be afraid of sudden terror or of the ruin of the wicked when it comes,

column3: for the Lord will be your confidence and will keep your foot from being caught
column4: for the Lord will be your confidence and will keep your foot from being caught.

column3: Do not withhold good from those to whom it is due when it is in your power to do it
column4: Do not withhold good from those to whom it is due, when it is in your power to do it.

column3: Do not say to your neighbor Go and come again tomorrow I will give itwhen you have it with you
column4: Do not say to your neighbor, “Go, and come again, tomorrow I will give it”—when you have it with you.

column3: Do not plan evil against your neighbor who dwells trustingly beside you
column4: Do not plan evil against your neighbor, who dwells trustingly beside you.

column3: Do not contend with a man for no reason when he has done you no harm
column4: Do not contend with a man for no reason when he has done you no harm.

column3: Do not envy a man of violence and do not choose any of his ways
column4: Do not envy a man of violence and do not choose any of his ways,

column3: for the devious person is an abomination to the Lord but the upright are in his confidence
column4: for the devious person is an abomination to the Lord, but the upright are in his confidence.

column3: The Lords curse is on the house of the wicked but he blesses the dwelling of the righteous
column4: The Lord’s curse is on the house of the wicked, but he blesses the dwelling of the righteous.

column3: Toward the scorners he is scornful but to the humble he gives favor
column4: Toward the scorners, he is scornful, but to the humble, he gives favor.

column3: The wise will inherit honor but fools get disgrace
column4: The wise will inherit honor, but fools get disgrace.

column3: Hear O sons a father's instruction and be attentive that you may gain insight
column4: Hear, O sons, a father's instruction, and be attentive, that you may gain insight,

column3: for I give you good precepts do not forsake my teaching
column4: for I give you good precepts; do not forsake my teaching

column3: When I was a son with my father tender the only one in the sight of my mother
column4: When I was a son of my father, tender, the only one in the sight of my mother,

column3: he taught me and said to me Let your heart hold fast my words keep my commandments and live
column4: he taught me and said to me, "Let your heart hold fast my words; keep my commandments, and live.

column3: Get wisdom get insight do not forget and do not turn away from the words of my mouth
column4: Get wisdom; get insight; do not forget, and do not turn away from the words of my mouth.

column3: Do not forsake her and she will keep you love her and she will guard you
column4: Do not forsake her, and she will keep you; love her, and she will guard you.

column3: The beginning of wisdom is this Get wisdom and whatever you get get insight
column4: The beginning of wisdom is this: Get wisdom, and whatever you get, get insight.

column3: Prize her highly and she will exalt you she will honor you if you embrace her
column4: Prize her highly, and she will exalt you; she will honor you if you embrace her.

column3: She will place on your head a graceful garland she will bestow on you a beautiful crown
column4: She will place on your head a graceful garland; she will bestow on you a beautiful crown."

column3: Hear my son and accept my words that the years of your life may be many
column4: Hear, my son, and accept my words, that the years of your life may be many.

column3: I have taught you the way of wisdom I have led you in the paths of uprightness
column4: I have taught you the way of wisdom; I have led you in the paths of uprightness.

column3: When you walk your step will not be hampered and if you run you will not stumble
column4: When you walk, your step will not be hampered, and if you run, you will not stumble.

column3: Keep hold of instruction do not let go guard her for she is your life
column4: Keep hold of instruction; do not let go; guard her, for she is your life.

column3: Do not enter the path of the wicked and do not walk in the way of evil
column4: Do not enter the path of the wicked, and do not walk in the way of evil.

column3: Avoid it do not go on it turn away from it and pass on
column4: Avoid it; do not go on it; turn away from it and pass on.

column3: For they cannot sleep unless they have done wrong they are robbed of sleep unless they have made someone stumble
column4: For they cannot sleep unless they have done wrong; they are robbed of sleep unless they have made someone stumble.
column5: Cannot sleep, Robbed of Sleep, Stumble

column3: For they eat the bread of wickedness and drink the wine of violence
column4: For they eat the bread of wickedness and drink the wine of violence.

column3: But the path of the righteous is like the light of dawn which shines brighter and brighter until full day
column4: But the path of the righteous is like the light of dawn, which shines brighter and brighter until full day.

column3: The way of the wicked is like deep darkness they do not know over what they stumble
column4: The way of the wicked is like deep darkness; they do not know over what they stumble.

column3: My son be attentive to my words incline your ear to my sayings
column4: My son, be attentive to my words; incline your ear to my sayings.

column3: Let them not escape from your sight keep them within your heart
column4: Let them not escape from your sight; keep them within your heart.

column3: For they are life to those who find them and healing to all their flesh
column4: For they are life to those who find them, and healing to all their flesh.

column3: Keep your heart with all vigilance for from it flow the springs of life
column4: Keep your heart with all vigilance, for from it flow the springs of life.

column3: Put away from you crooked speech and put devious talk far from you
column4: Put away from you crooked speech, and put devious talk far from you.

column3: Let your eyes look directly forward and your gaze be straight before you
column4: Let your eyes look directly forward, and your gaze be straight before you.

column3: Ponder the path of your feet then all your ways will be sure
column4: Ponder the path of your feet; then all your ways will be sure.

column3: Do not swerve to the right or to the left turn your foot away from evil
column4: Do not swerve to the right or to the left; turn your foot away from evil.

column3: My son pay attention to my wisdom turn your ear to my understanding
column4: My son, pay attention to my wisdom, turn your ear to my understanding,

column3: that you may retain discretion and your lips may keep knowledge
column4: that you may retain discretion and your lips may keep knowledge.

column3: For the lips of a forbidden woman drip honey and her mouth is smoother than oil
column4: For the lips of a forbidden woman drip honey, and her mouth is smoother than oil,

column3: but in the end she is bitter as wormwood sharp as a two edged sword
column4: but in the end she is bitter as wormwood, sharp as a two-edged sword.

column3: Her feet go down to death her steps lead straight to Sheol
column4: Her feet go down to death; her steps lead straight to Sheol.

column3: For she strays far from the path of life her ways wander and she does not know it
column4: For she strays far from the path of life; her ways wander, and she does not know it.

column3: So now listen to me sons and do not depart from the words of my mouth
column4: So now, listen to me, sons, and do not depart from the words of my mouth:
column5: Heed Instruction, Avoid Temptation, Choose Wisely

column3: Avoid her path go not near her dwelling place
column4: Avoid her path, go not near her dwelling place,

column3: lest you give your honor to others and your years to the cruel
column4: lest you give your honor to others and your years to the cruel,

column3: lest strangers feast on your wealth and your labors enrich the house of foreigners
column4: lest strangers feast on your wealth, and your labors enrich the house of foreigners.

column3: Then you will groan in the end when your body and flesh are consumed
column4: Then you will groan in the end, when your body and flesh are consumed.

column3: And you will say How I hated discipline and how my heart spurned correction
column4: And you will say, "How I hated discipline, and how my heart spurned correction!

column3: I did not listen to the voice of my teachers or incline my ear to my instructors
column4: I did not listen to the voice of my teachers, or incline my ear to my instructors.

column3: I was close to all evil in the midst of the assembly and the congregation
column4: I was close to all evil in the midst of the assembly and the congregation."

column3: Drink water from your own cistern running water from your own well
column4: Drink water from your own cistern, running water from your own well.

column3: Should your springs overflow in the streets your streams of water in the public squares
column4: Should your springs overflow in the streets, your streams of water in the public squares?

column3: Let them be yours alone never to be shared with strangers
column4: Let them be yours alone, never to be shared with strangers.

column3: May your fountain be blessed and may you rejoice in the wife of your youth
column4: May your fountain be blessed, and may you rejoice in the wife of your youth.

column3: A loving doe a graceful deer let her breasts satisfy you always may you ever be intoxicated with her love
column4: A loving doe, a graceful deer—let her breasts satisfy you always, may you ever be intoxicated with her love.

column3: Why my son be intoxicated with another mans wife Why embrace the bosom of a wayward woman
column4: Why, my son, be intoxicated with another man's wife? Why embrace the bosom of a wayward woman?

column3: For a mans ways are before the eyes of the Lord and he ponders all his paths
column4: For a man's ways are before the eyes of the Lord, and he ponders all his paths.

column3: The iniquities of the wicked ensnare them and the cords of their sin bind them
column4: The iniquities of the wicked ensnare them, and the cords of their sin bind them.

column3: They die for lack of discipline and because of their great folly they are led astray
column4: They die for lack of discipline, and because of their great folly they are led astray.

column3: My son if you have put up security for your neighbor have given your pledge for a stranger
column4: My son, if you have put up security for your neighbor, have given your pledge for a stranger,

column3: if you are snared in the words of your mouth caught in the words of your mouth
column4: if you are snared in the words of your mouth, caught in the words of your mouth,

column3: then do this my son and save yourself for you have come into the hand of your neighbor go hasten and plead urgently with your neighbor
column4: then do this, my son, and save yourself, for you have come into the hand of your neighbor: go, hasten, and plead urgently with your neighbor.

column3: Give your eyes no sleep and your eyelids no slumber
column4: Give your eyes no sleep and your eyelids no slumber;

column3: save yourself like a gazelle from the hand of the hunter like a bird from the hand of the fowler
column4: save yourself like a gazelle from the hand of the hunter, like a bird from the hand of the fowler.

column3: Go to the ant O sluggard consider her ways and be wise
column4: Go to the ant, O sluggard; consider her ways, and be wise.

column3: Without having any chief officer or ruler
column4: Without having any chief, officer, or ruler,

column3: she prepares her bread in summer and gathers her food in harvest
column4: she prepares her bread in summer and gathers her food in harvest.

column3: How long will you lie there O sluggard When will you arise from your sleep
column4: How long will you lie there, O sluggard? When will you arise from your sleep?

column3: A little sleep a little slumber a little folding of the hands to rest
column4: A little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to rest,

column3: and poverty will come upon you like a robber and want like an armed man
column4: and poverty will come upon you like a robber, and want like an armed man.

column3: A worthless person a wicked man goes about with crooked speech
column4: A worthless person, a wicked man, goes about with crooked speech,

column3: winks with his eyes signals with his feet points with his finger
column4: winks with his eyes, signals with his feet, points with his finger,

column3: with perverted heart devises evil continually sowing discord
column4: with perverted heart devises evil, continually sowing discord;

column3: therefore calamity will come upon him suddenly in a moment he will be broken beyond healing
column4: therefore calamity will come upon him suddenly; in a moment he will be broken beyond healing.

column3: There are six things that the LORD hates seven that are an abomination to him
column4: There are six things that the LORD hates, seven that are an abomination to him:

column3: haughty eyes a lying tongue and hands that shed innocent blood
column4: haughty eyes, a lying tongue, and hands that shed innocent blood,

column3: a heart that devises wicked plans feet that make haste to run to evil
column4: a heart that devises wicked plans, feet that make haste to run to evil,

column3: a false witness who breathes out lies and one who sows discord among brothers
column4: a false witness who breathes out lies, and one who sows discord among brothers.

column3: My son keep your fathers commandment,and forsake not your mothers teaching
column4: My son, keep your father's commandment, and forsake not your mother's teaching.

column3: Bind them on your heart always tie them around your neck
column4: Bind them on your heart always; tie them around your neck.

column3: When you walk they will lead you when you lie down they will watch over you and when you awake they will talk with you
column4: When you walk, they will lead you; when you lie down, they will watch over you; and when you awake, they will talk with you.

column3: For the commandment is a lamp and the teaching a light and the reproofs of discipline are the way of life
column4: For the commandment is a lamp and the teaching a light, and the reproofs of discipline are the way of life,

column3: to preserve you from the evil woman from the smooth tongue of the adulteress
column4: to preserve you from the evil woman, from the smooth tongue of the adulteress.

column3: Do not desire her beauty in your heart and do not let her capture you with her eyelashes
column4: Do not desire her beauty in your heart, and do not let her capture you with her eyelashes;

column3: for the price of a prostitute is only a loaf of bread but a married womanhunts down a precious life
column4: for the price of a prostitute is only a loaf of bread, but a married womanhunts down a precious life.

column3: Can a man carry fire next to his chest and his clothes not be burned
column4: Can a man carry fire next to his chest and his clothes not be burned?

column3: Or can one walk on hot coals and his feet not be scorched
column4: Or can one walk on hot coals and his feet not be scorched?

column3: So is he who goes in to his neighbors wife none who touches her will go unpunished
column4: So is he who goes in to his neighbor's wife; none who touches her will go unpunished.

column3: People do not despise a thief if he steals to satisfy his appetite when he is hungry
column4: People do not despise a thief if he steals to satisfy his appetite when he is hungry,

column3: but if he is caught he will pay sevenfold he will give all the goods of his house
column4: but if he is caught, he will pay sevenfold; he will give all the goods of his house.

column3: He who commits adultery lacks sense he who does it destroys himself
column4: He who commits adultery lacks sense; he who does it destroys himself.

column3: He will get wounds and dishonor and his disgrace will not be wiped away
column4: He will get wounds and dishonor, and his disgrace will not be wiped away.

column3: For jealousy makes a man furious and he will not spare when he takes revenge
column4: For jealousy makes a man furious, and he will not spare when he takes revenge.

column3: He will accept no compensation he will refuse though you multiply gifts
column4: He will accept no compensation; he will refuse though you multiply gifts.

column3: My son keep my words and treasure up my commandments with you
column4: My son, keep my words and treasure up my commandments with you;

column3: keep my commandments and live keep my teaching as the apple of your eye
column4: Keep my commandments and live; keep my teaching as the apple of your eye;

column4: And behold, the woman meets him, dressed as a prostitute, wily of heart.

column3: She is loud and wayward her feet do not stay at home
column4: She is loud and wayward; her feet do not stay at home;

column3: now in the street now in the market and at every corner she lies in wait
column4: Now in the street, now in the market, and at every corner she lies in wait.

column3: She seizes him and kisses him and with bold face she says to him
column4: She seizes him and kisses him, and with bold face she says to him,

column3: I had to offer sacrifices and today I have paid my vows
column4: I had to offer sacrifices, and today I have paid my vows;

column3: so now I have come out to meet you to seek you eagerly and I have found you
column4: So now I have come out to meet you, to seek you eagerly, and I have found you.
column5: out, come, meet, seek, eagerly, found

column5: spread, couch, belongings, colored, linens, egyptian, linen, coverings

column3: I have perfumed my bed with myrrh aloes and cinnamon
column4: I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.

column3: Come let us take our fill of love till morning let us delight ourselves with love
column4: Come, let us take our fill of love till morning; let us delight ourselves with love.

column3: For my husband is not at home he has gone on a long journey
column4: For my husband is not at home; he has gone on a long journey;

column3: he took a bag of money with him at full moon he will come home
column4: He took a bag of money with him; at full moon, he will come home.

column4: With much seductive speech, she persuades him; with her smooth talk, she compels him.

column3: And now O sons listen to me and be attentive to the words of my mouth
column4: And now, O sons, listen to me, and be attentive to the words of my mouth.

column3: Let not your heart turn aside to her ways do not stray into her paths
column4: Let not your heart turn aside to her ways; do not stray into her paths,
